abstract: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether instances of the receiver are capable of responding to a given selector.

declaration.code: class func instancesRespond(to aSelector: Selector!) -> Bool

overview:
## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/YES] if instances of the receiver are capable of responding to `aSelector` messages, otherwise [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO].

## Discussion

If `aSelector` messages are forwarded to other objects, instances of the class are able to receive those messages without error even though this method returns [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO].

To ask the class whether it, rather than its instances, can respond to a particular message, send to the class instead the  `NSObject` protocol instance method [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObjectProtocol/responds(to:)].

# instancesRespond(to:)

**Type Method**

Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether instances of the receiver are capable of responding to a given selector.

## Declaration

```swift
class func instancesRespond(to aSelector: Selector!) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **aSelector**: A [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/General/Conceptual/DevPedia-CocoaCore/Selector.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40008195-CH48].

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/YES] if instances of the receiver are capable of responding to `aSelector` messages, otherwise [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO].

## Discussion

If `aSelector` messages are forwarded to other objects, instances of the class are able to receive those messages without error even though this method returns [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO].

To ask the class whether it, rather than its instances, can respond to a particular message, send to the class instead the  `NSObject` protocol instance method [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObjectProtocol/responds(to:)].
